definition: Tanka, boat-dwelling people of Guangdong, Guangxi, Fujian, Hainan, and Zhejiang provinces

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
Siraya, one of the indigenous peoples of Taiwan
Hoklo people, southern Chinese people of Taiwan
Xiyu or Hsiyu township in Penghu county 澎湖縣|澎湖县[Peng2 hu2 xian4] (Pescadores Islands), Taiwan
Nan'ao Island in Shantou 汕頭|汕头[Shan4 tou2], Guangdong
Min dialects, spoken in Fujian Province, Taiwan etc
Drung or Dulong ethnic group of northwest Yunnan
Kavalan, one of the indigenous peoples of Taiwan
Khmer kingdom of Kampuchea or Cambodia/Chinese term for Cambodia from 7th to 15th century
Qiongzhou, historic name for Hainan Island 海南島|海南岛[Hai3 nan2 Dao3]
to scull (with a single oar, usually mounted on the stern of the boat)
